The height of the root node is 2, and the number of edges in the longest path from the root node to any leaf node is 7.

The tree has 14 nodes, and the root node is n. The height of the root node is the maximum distance from the root to any leaf node. The longest path from the root node to any leaf node includes all the nodes in the path from the root to the leaf, plus the height of the leaf node.

In this case, the longest path includes nodes n, o, p, q, r, s, t, u, v, w, x, y, z, ab, bb, cb, dc, ec, fc, gc, and jc. There are 13 edges in this path (not including the root node), so the total number of edges is 13 + 7 = 20.

Note that some nodes have multiple leaves connected to them (e.g., p has p->q and p->r), so the total number of leaves may be greater than the number of nodes. However, it is still possible to determine the height of the root node and the number of edges in the longest path from the root node to any leaf node using these methods.
